fields.description: We have several form fields with long verbose field names along the lines of "If you answered yes to any of the above questions, have you received approval from the head of the department?".  These fields worked fine in JIRA 3.13, but if such a field exists in JIRA 4.0 it will be impossible to configure the "Columns to Display" box on the configuration page for the Filter Results gadget.  The vertical scroll bar ends up pushed "under" the right edge of the gadget and can no longer be used.  I have not found equivalent keyboard shortcuts that would allow you to multi-select non-continuous items in the field, so it would appear that this scroll bar is required in order to set these values.
fields.summary: "Columns to Display" cannot be selected in a Filter Results gadget when a field with a name longer than the width of the multi-select box exists

fields.description:
On the "Backing up Data" and Restoring Data pages there is no mention of backing up and restoring the data/avatars directory when backing up attachments.

The following was the page I was using while going through the upgrade:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Backing+Up+Data
https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/restoring-data-861253828.html

It would be great to include a reference to this article on all pages of the document:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/custom-avatars-missing-after-a-jira-application-gets-upgraded-or-migrated-224395280.html
fields.summary: Upgrade/Backup documentation doesn't mention copying avatars

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
# In the Admin, edit the description of an Issue Type to have an apostrophe in it.
# Add the Issue Statistics gadget to the dashboard.
# Configure the gadget's Statistic Type to be 'Issue Type'.

h4. Outcome
* On IE8 the name of the Issue Type with the description containing an apostrophe (') will not be visible.
* On Firefox, hovering the mouse over the Issue Type name will pop up its description truncated at the point of the apostrophe.

h4.Expected Outcome:
* The Issue Type name should be visible in IE and holding the mouse over the Issue Type should show its description in full.

This also affects the 'Priority' field and probably all others that add a 'title' attribute to the link.

h4. Workaround
* Remove apostrophes from the descriptions of the affected issue fields.
fields.summary: Issue Statistics gadget incorrectly escapes apostrophes in description text

fields.description:
Even when I'm doing nothing at all the JIRA 4.0 dashboard uses 30-40% of my CPU.  CPU Load varies with number of active gadgets and is near zero when all gadgets are removed.  Changing the focus to another Firefox tab causes the CPU usage to drop to zero. 

I've tried this on our local JIRA 4.0 instance and on jira.atlassian.com with the same results. I don't seem to have this problem when using JIRA 4.0 with Internet Explorer 7.0.  http://www.google.com/ig does not have this problem.

This is a bit irritating and makes performance on the dashboard seem really sluggish...
fields.summary: Dashboard uses CPU even when nothing is happening

fields.description:
I have included the server information in the Environment section and also attached the catalina.out file for you to look at.

ISSUE:
I have the Jira Suite Utils loaded and tried using the "Update issue custom field portion of the issue to update a field in the workflow.

It works fine until I went in and changed the Project Description field in the project I was adding issues to.

Then I got the following errors.
ERROR [atlassian.jira.project.DefaultProjectManager] Existing issue found for key ASBRASS-889. Incrementing key.
 which was repeated 3 times. for the previous three issues that were created before the description was changed for the project.

Questions:
1. What order should this plugin be put in the workflow?
2. Does the workflow actually re-index the issue so that it can be found when doing a filter?
3. Am I getting corruption in the DB based on this error?
fields.summary: Changing the Project Description field causes an error to be thrown in the catalina.out field when a new issue is created.

fields.description: As an administrator, I seem to create a lot of custom fields, screens, workflow statuses, etc. I was wondering if there could be some magic button within JIRA (or just a Confluence page with the SQL), that could go through all of the custom stuff (fields, screens, workflows, etc) and remove the ones that are not being used in a project. Every month or so, I go through the 250ish custom fields and remove the ones that are no longer used. Then I do that for everything else. It takes about a days worth of time to 'clean JIRA' each time I do this. Something automated will be very helpful.
fields.summary: Administrator button to 'clean JIRA'

fields.description:
By 'forensic' anaysis of the past email traffic, I could find out that since version 3.13.3 or 3.13.4 users that are not member of at least one group of the "global permission - Jira Users" do not receive any notifications by mail.

Searching through the release notes I could not find any feature / change that discribes this behavior.

We are using technical users that will never log in jira, with mailing list addresses as email addr, to notify many persons when creating an issue.

This won't work anymore unless the technical user has the right to login - which makes no sense.

Has this behavior come inside the code by 'accident'?

Probably related to JRA-19509
fields.summary: Email notification to users with no global jira user rights won't work

fields.description:
I've been requested to send anonymized backups of our JIRA to Atlassian in two ocasions. On both of them, due to security reasons, I was not allowed to send anonymized backups, due to the fact that worklogs, users names and e-mails are not anonymized.

It would be nice to have an anonymized backup that hides all of this sensitive information. Worklogs might be replaced with "xxxx" and users names and e-mails might be scrambled or partially deleted and replaced with some kind of sequencial numbers.
fields.summary: Totally anonymous backup

fields.description:
This is a regression from Jira 3.13.

Some customers will remove the resolution field from their field configuration, and set the resolution as part of the workflow, through a post function. This is useful if only one type of resolution is allowed for a given issue type.

If the resolution is not part of the field configuration for the project/issue type, then all the issues for which that field configuration is used will be shown as resolved in the project road map.

Adding the resolution back to the filed configuration and reindexing the project fixes the problem. Reindex is needed, so it seems like that's where we take the information from.

But as explained before, some customers do not want that field as part of their field configuration. This used to work in 3.13, and some customers depends on this functionality.
fields.summary: Resolution in the Browse Project road map incorrectly calculated

fields.description:
This needs to be done in conjunction with a major release.

* update help_paths.properties --- change occurrences of "http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Home" to "http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/"
* work with Web team to update any WAC links -- see https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/WTF-1053 ((/) DONE) and https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/WTF-1092
* work with Web team to update any Google links (not required --- see https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/WTF-1053)
* make sure that /HOME redirects to the new page (or if that's not possible, rename the existing page to "JIRA Documentation", then create a new copy called "Home", put a note at the top and make it an orphan --- then eventually delete it)
fields.summary: rename the JIRA homepage on CAC from "Home" to "JIRA Documentation"

fields.description:
DefaultJiraDataImporter.java
...
...
...
line 543: else
line 544: {
line 545: // Check scope of custom field - can the custom field be set for this issue type and  project?
line 546:    if (!customField.isGlobal())
line 547:    {
line 548:       if (customField.getRelevantConfig(issueFactory.getIssue(issueGV)) == null)
...
...
...


This issue is created due to https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-49112.

In DefaultJiraDataImporter class, there should be a checking (before line 546) to check if a custom field value is valid/ invalid before getting the behaviors of custom field. User might have specified wrong custom field key (due to typo error etc) which cause the import to abort.
fields.summary: CSV Importer - Check if custom field is valid before importing

fields.description:
Most JIRA gadgets cannot be configured when inserted into the JIRA dashboard when using IE7 as the browser, as they are not correctly sized.

e.g. Using IE7:
1) Dashboard -> Add Gadget.
2) "Activity Stream" -> Add It Now -> Finished.

The gadget is inserted into the dashboard, but it is too short to see any of the configuration options and is hence unusable.

Works in JIRA 4.0.1 but not in 4.0.2.
Works in places where the activity stream is preconfigured (such as Issue Activity Stream or User Activity Stream).
Works in IE6, IE8 and FireFox 3.5.5.
fields.summary: Most JIRA gadgets cannot be configured on Dashboard in IE7 due to resizing bug

fields.description: To fix JRA-19617 we need to upgrade to activity stream 3.0.13
fields.summary: Need to release Streams 3.0.13 and upgrade JIRA

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

# Create an empty dashboard and add an "Average Age Chart" gadget.
# Set it to use a filter/project with lots of issues such that Days Previously = _N_ returns <5 results, while Days Previously = _M_ returns >25 results.
# Set Days Previously to _N_ and save.
# Click the gadget's maximise button to put it into canvas mode.
# Use the dropdown menu to edit the gadget's settings.
# Set Days Previously to _M_ and save.

*Result:* The dashboard is not resized to accommodate the greater number of issues in the gadget, so the iframe appears clipped. (See screenshot.)

Note: Depending on how quickly the ajax response completes, this may intermittently work as expected. Try using Charles (HTTP proxy) or a browser other than Chrome to ensure repeatable results.
fields.summary: Editing a gadget while in canvas mode causes the gadget iframe to be clipped

h3. Summary
Editing existing Work logs while having 'Adjust Automatically' selected causes the Estimations to be calculated differently than expected.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
*Scenario 1*
# Create a Task with an Original Estimate of 6 hours
# Log 8 hours of work
# Edit the work logged to 6 hours

*Scenario 2*
# Create a task with no Original Estimate
# Log 8 hours of work
# Edit the work log down to 2 hours of work

h3. Expected Results
Scenario 1: Results in 0 hours remaining
Scenario 2: Results in 0 hours remaining

h3. Actual Results
Scenario 1: Results in 2 hours remaining
Scenario 2: Results in 6 hours remaining

h3.Workaround
Do not use Automatic calculation, manually enter what time remains.




 
 
_Original Description_
{quote}
The remaining estimate field is incorrect in the following situation:

    * Task entered with original Estimate of 6 hrs
    * Worklog entered (8 hrs)
    * Worklog edited down to 6 hrs

After doing this:

Original Estimate = 6 hrs
Time Spent = 6 hrs
Remaining Estimate = 2 hrs

In this situation, shouldn't the remaining estimate be 0 hrs?{quote}
fields.summary: Remaining estimate is inconsistent when editing a worklog down

fields.description:
When bulk merging versions either the Affects Versions field.

 Recently we decided to make the version list more manageable by merging our nightly build versions into their subsequent released versions. I spent a long time today doing this, for 5 years worth of builds. I then decided to mark our released versions as released in Jira - until now we've been tracking releases externally but not in Jira. One of the release screens flagged an unresolved issue: PIRATES-47084. Then I noticed something bad: the Affects Version field has been cleared out, now reporting 'None'! The Fix Version changed from a deleted version to the corresponding released version as I expected.

I made a sampling of issues and found that for most issues, both Fix Version and Affects Version were cleared. (PIRATES-32690). In some issues both fields changed. (PIRATES-52709) In some issues Fix Version changed and Affects Version was cleared. (PIRATES-47084) In some issues Affects Version changed and Fix Version was cleared. (PIRATES-53104)
For some issues there is an entry in the change history, for others there is not. (PIRATES-32690)
Affects Version for PIRATES-52647 changed from 1.18.59.0 to 1.18.60.0 but in the same merge transaction Affects Version for PIRATES-52631 was cleared from 1.18.55.0 to None.

It appears that if the merge from and merge into versions were adjacent in the version list the field changed and if they were non-adjacent the field was cleared.
fields.summary: Bulk Merge Versions

fields.description:
New in version 4.0 is a bug that causes all filters that search based on a Fix Version or Affects Version to be broken after the related version is renamed.  This means that it is now, from a practical standpoint, impossible for us to rename versions.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a filter that searches for a matching Fix Version which is assigned to at least one issue
# Using that filter returns the resulting matching issues as expected
# Rename the Fix Version on that project
# The filter will no longer return any results
fields.summary: Renaming a version breaks all related filters

Regarding the default/internal MailListener, the documentation states:

This listener is usually always turned on in JIRA - see Email Notifications for more details. If you want to write more complex or more specific notifications, you can disable the internal MailListener and add your own.

However, as the MailListener is marked as 'internal', it is not possible to be remove it. 

At present, it is necessary to recompile the MailListener class and set isInternal to false.

Need to allow users to delete/remove the MailListener through UI.

fields.description:
We oftentimes like to link directly to FishEye changesets in comments that we make in JIRA.  While you can use the FishEye plugin in JIRA to auto-update tickets based on changesets in FishEye, there is no way to do the opposite: auto-link to FishEye changesets from comments in JIRA.

Trac handles this very well in that you can enter [123] or r123 and either will automatically link directly to changeset 123.  I understand that the FishEye scenario is slightly more complex in that there may be multiple projects in FishEye, so this may require adding a project key to FishEye like you have in JIRA and Bamboo.  So, I could do something like:

HHH[123]

in a comment in JIRA, and JIRA would automatically link it to changeset 123 within the HHH project in FishEye.
fields.summary: Auto link JIRA comments to FishEye changesets

fields.description:
Please consider this scenario:

----

We have a JIRA user Mr. Foobar with the email account foo@bar.com.  He has a JIRA account and that email address is specified in his JIRA profile.  

For some reason Mr. Foobar receives a notification email from JIRA.  Maybe someone added him as a watcher to an issue, or maybe he created the issue, someone recently commented, etc.

Mr. Foobar doesn't actually receive mail at bar.com.  Instead he automatically forwards all his email to his personal Gmail account:  foobar@gmail.com

He responds to the JIRA notification email using Gmail expecting a comment to be added to the issue.  Instead, the comment is discarded because JIRA doesn't associate foobar@gmail.com with a JIRA user.

----

JIRA should be smart enough to handle this scenario.  Perhaps this could be implemented by adding and matching a email header or UUID in the notification email?
fields.summary: Comment by email from non-matching email addresses

Nevertheless I share my experience that other people do not waste his precious time over this issue.

Performed steps:

1. JAVA_HOME has been set as environment variable, with value: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17

2. %JAVA_HOME%\bin\keytool -genkey -alias tomcat -keyalg RSA -keystore "C:/Program Files/Apache Software Foundation/Tomcat 6.0/open_ssl/.keystore"

I've used default password "changeit"

3. %JAVA_HOME%\bin\keytool -export -alias tomcat -file "C:/Program Files/Apache Software Foundation/Tomcat 6.0/open_ssl/exported_tomcat_keystore.crt" -keystore "C:/Program Files/Apache Software Foundation/Tomcat 6.0/open_ssl/.keystore"
I've used default password "changeit"

I've used default password "changeit"

5. %JAVA_HOME%\bin\keytool -import -alias apache_tomcat -file "C:/Program Files/Apache Software Foundation/Apache2.2/conf/ssl.crt/test.environment.crt" -keystore "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\jre\lib\security\cacerts"

6. Apache configuration:

<VirtualHost *:443>

truststoreFile="C:/Program Files/Java/jdk1.6.0_17/jre/lib/security/cacerts" truststorePass="changeit"
clientAuth="false" sslProtocol="TLS"/> 

I think, steps above at least should be overwritten in Jiras's documentation or in article http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Gadgets+do+not+display+correctly+after+upgrade+to+JIRA+4.0

May be for better understanding every step should be well commented.

Thank you.

fields.description:
The WSDL from the SOAP RPC plugin after a call to a method returning a RemoteWorkLog will include a RemoteWorklogImpl. This is an internal class that should not be exposed to SOAP.

This problem should not cause any user visible problems, we are just exposing our implementation details as part of the WSDL which could make them harder to change later.

I have been able to actually track down the cause of this issue. Basically, the {{RemoteWorklogImpl}} will not be seen until the first time a method with a {{RemoteWorklog}} is called. This is caused by a "feature" of Axis (our SOAP engine) in that it looks at the runtime type of the service result rather than its compile time type. For example:

{code:xml}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>

<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" 
	xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
	<soapenv:Body>
		<ns1:getWorklogsResponse soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xmlns:ns1="http://soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com">
			<getWorklogsReturn soapenc:arrayType="ns2:RemoteWorklog[1]" xsi:type="soapenc:Array" xmlns:ns2="http://beans.soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com" xmlns:soapenc="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/">
				<getWorklogsReturn href="#id0"/>
			</getWorklogsReturn>
		</ns1:getWorklogsResponse>
		<multiRef id="id0" soapenc:root="0" soapenv:encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xsi:type="ns3:RemoteWorklogImpl" 
			xmlns:soapenc="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" xmlns:ns3="http://service.soap.rpc.jira.atlassian.com">
			<author xsi:type="xsd:string">admin</author>
			<comment xsi:type="xsd:string">This is a test</comment>
			<created xsi:type="xsd:dateTime">2009-12-07T08:16:27.158Z</created>
			<groupLevel xsi:type="xsd:string" xsi:nil="true"/>
			<id xsi:type="xsd:string">10000</id>
			<roleLevelId xsi:type="xsd:string" xsi:nil="true"/>
			<startDate xsi:type="xsd:dateTime">2009-12-07T08:16:00.000Z</startDate>
			<timeSpent xsi:type="xsd:string">3h</timeSpent>
			<timeSpentInSeconds xsi:type="xsd:long">10800</timeSpentInSeconds>
			<updateAuthor xsi:type="xsd:string">admin</updateAuthor>
			<updated xsi:type="xsd:dateTime">2009-12-07T08:16:27.158Z</updated>
		</multiRef>
	</soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>
{code}

Notice that even though the SOAP reply is a {{ns2:RemoteWorklog}} (the static interface type) AXIS actually sends back a subclass {{ns3:RemoteWorklogImpl}} (the actual runtime type). By doing this AXIS updates its internal structures such that the {{RemoteWorklogImpl}} now appears in the WSDL.

This problem is related to JRA-13801. Tokes worked around the problem in JRA-13801 in a way that allowed .NET soap to work. I guess the complete solution would be to remove the RemoteWorklogImpl as we don't need it. We have to be careful with backwards compatibility.
fields.summary: The RPC Plugin includes a RemoteWorklogImpl type in the WSDL after returning from method that returns RemoteWorklog objects.

I just did a JQL search where I wanted to filter by component. When I did "component = ", I got a dropdown with suggestions, but the particular JIRA instance I was looking at had hundreds of components. The autocomplete results only showed components starting with letters "A" and "B". There was no scrollbar, or even a visual indication that more results might be available. If I typed the first letter of the component, that did start listing components starting with that letter, but I think the UI here is unintuitive and not user friendly.

A scrollbar would be a start, but still probably wouldn't scale to hundreds of elements. And, as an aside, it would be even nicer if JQL pre-filtered the components based on the project I selected. That would obviate the problem somewhat since most projects don't have hundreds of components.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Go to jira.atlassian.com
2. Add filter results gadget
3. In project/filters input type *My JIRA 4.0.2 Bugs*
4. If you are in the *jira-dev* group you should *see a filter* named the same as your input. However it does not appear.

note: This affects all gadgets that have filter/project picker.
fields.summary: Cannot select some filters from filters/project picker in gadgets

fields.description: This issue has already been resolved in AG (See https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AG-1189). This issue can be resolved by back porting the fix, or upgrading to Atlassian Gadgets 2.0.1.
fields.summary: Gadget is resizing at oauth button screen in IE and Safari causing the button to be obscured
Improve documentation for "params" map of IssueEvent

fields.description:
For multi-valuated fields like fix versions or components, it would be very useful to be able to add or remove specific element(s) from the list without editing the whole list as they can be different for each item being bulk-edited.

For instance, I'am bulk editing items A and B. A's fix version is V1 and B's fix version is V2. I am using this new so called differential operation to add V3 as fix version to item A and B so that A's fix versions now are V1,V3 and B's fix versions are now V2,V3.
fields.summary: Differential Operations Support in Bulk Edition Operations for Multi-Valuated Fields

fields.description: I've created a Custom Field named 'Inv Field 1' as Select List. I've added options white, blue, red to the custom field. Then I created a number of issues, some assigned blue, some red, and some none. Now that I removed option blue from the Custom Field, the 'blue' issues lost their value as on the first screen. But it appeared it has not become the same as none because 'is EMPTY' didn't pick up them. (Look at the second screen.)
fields.summary: Custom field option removed, affected issues not picked up by 'is EMPTY' condition though shown as having no value

fields.description:
If a user save a filter with a french character in it, it is impossible to view the list for the filter (upper right corner)
Characters used: é, ç, è, ê, ï, etc etc
fields.summary: The functionality "Filter" doesn't work when saved filters have french characters. See .attachment with this issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-19911].
  {panel}

*User Stories* 

* As a JIRA user I want to run reports of all tasks and their associated sub-tasks
* As a JIRA user I want to create a filter to show only tasks and their sub-tasks.
* As a JIRA user I want to create a filter to show only new features and their sub-tasks.
* As a JIRA user I want to create a filter to show only bugs and their sub-tasks.
* As a Green Hopper user I want to create a filter using issue type sub-task with parent issues type of Tasks so that I can see a chart with tasks and their sub-tasks.

I've used the user stories to explain our need. We are creating different types of issues (new features, improvements, tasks and bugs) with sub-tasks and I need to be able to create filters to show just the issue type with their sub tasks.
fields.summary: Allow filtering of sub-task issues by the parent issue type

fields.description:
In the JAC logs there appear to be cases where users are hitting JAC with a null user-agent header. UserAgentUtilImpl does not check for null and throws an NPE.

To reproduce: 
1) From the command-line, run:
{noformat}
telnet <hostname> <port>
{noformat}
2) Send the following command:
{noformat}
GET http://<hostname>:<port>/secure/Dashboard.jspa HTTP/1.0
{noformat}

You should get an error page back from JIRA and a stack trace in the logs.
I'm not sure why users are sending requests with no user-agent, but it is possible that some web crawlers are doing so.

The null user-agent value is retrieved by AccessKeyHelperImpl and passed to getUserAgentInfo in UserAgentImpl:

AccessKeyHelperImpl.java
{noformat}
51  final String userAgent = request.getHeader(BrowserUtils.USER_AGENT_HEADER);
52  final UserAgentUtil userAgentUtil = new UserAgentUtilImpl();
53  return userAgentUtil.getUserAgentInfo(userAgent);
{noformat}

UserAgentUtilImpl.java
{noformat}
12    public UserAgent getUserAgentInfo(String userAgent)
13    {
14        return new UserAgent(getBrowser(userAgent), getOS(userAgent));
15    }
...
86    private Browser getBrowser(String userAgent)
87    {
88        for (BrowserFamily browserFamily : BrowserFamily.values())
89        {
90            if (userAgent.contains(browserFamily.getUserAgentString()))
{noformat}

fields.summary: EmoticonRendererComponent throws NPE on JAC
JiraVelocityUtils.java

fields.description:
In our JIRA installation, using the standard workflow with JIRA 3.13.2-#335, you can click "Start Progress" and the issue appropriately changes to "In Progress."

However, once you do that, you cannot Resolve or Close the issue.  You can't edit its workflow.  It's stuck.  Clicking "Stop Progress" doesn't do anything.

This happens for all issue types in all projects.  We're using the system default built-in workflow, "jira."  The workflow transition steps look OK.

Our workaround is to clone the stuck issue, and then delete the original.  In-elegant, obviously, but it works ;)
fields.summary: In Progress issues cannot be resolved or closed -- must be deleted

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* [Capture|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Attaching+a+Screenshot#AttachingaScreenshot-capturing] a screen shot
* In an issue, under Operations click Attach Screenshot to this issue
* Click Paste.  It should not work in Firefox, but should work in other browsers.
fields.summary: Attach screenshot does not work on Firefox in Jira 4.0 (but does work in Safari/IE)

fields.description:
When dropdowns breakout, they are inserted into the parent dom.
When two of the same gdaget are on the same page, and you open up the same dropdown on each, a div with same id is inserted into the parent.

When the dropdown closes, it should be removed from the parent frame.
fields.summary: Breakout dropdowns in gadgets can cause conflicting dom ids in parent

fields.description:
Breakout Dropdowns in gadget's shadows are not rendered correctly.

This is noticeable on the actions dropdown.  The shadow is only applied to the top 14px or so.
fields.summary: Breakout Dropdowns in gadget's shadows are not rendered correctly
Provide options to enable/disable Apache Authentication
The intro gadget should have a link to "Add User" if there is no assignable user on a new instance

fields.description: It would be a great feature if you were able to select what users appeared in a Custom Field User Picker from the permissions scheme page. Just an item there that you could define which users can be set
fields.summary: Custom Field User Picker Users assignable in Permissions Scheme

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to qa-eac.
2. Add a new page and add "Assigned to me" JIRA gadget.
3. Don't click on "login & approve" button. save it with default options.
4. In the macro browser dialog, it show user "0 matching issues".
4. Try to look for "Edit" and OAuth lock.

Result
1. Its not visible properly. Snapshot at http://skitch.com/veenubharara/njbsh/confluence-gadgets-mark-hrynczak-extranet

Expected:
1. The icons should be properly visible.
fields.summary: "Edit" and "OAuth" icon is not properly visible when user customize "Assigned to me" JIRA gadget in Confluence

fields.description: The section "Deactivating a User" from the "Managing Users" Documentation page does not explain that users need to be removed from the "Assignable User" Project Role as well so they don't continue showing in the assignee list after being deactivated.
fields.summary: Modify the "Deactivating a User" section from the "Managing Users" Documentation
Close This JIRA

fields.description:
(raised from [JSP-48401|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-48401])

At the top of subscription email containing by default: 

* Filter name
* Filter description
* Subscriber's name
* Filter results

...I would like to add a custom message e.g. "_Please check if the filter results below reflect reality!_"

This message would be a part of subscription configuration, because each subscription should have a different message.

Currently, the only way to accomplish such a functionality is to [modify email templates|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Customising+Email+Content], but that would add custom message to _all subscriptions_, unless excluded with some "if" within the Velocity template. But this would be a dirty hack.
fields.summary: Custom email message configurable per subscription

fields.description:
This issue was originally raised against Confluence (http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-17549). Since then we have created a patched Felix 2.0.1 version which will be included in Confluence 3.1 and fix the issue if Confluence starts first.
To also make it work reliably if JIRA starts first we patched and upgraded the Felix 1.2.1 version of Plugins 2.3.x (https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/PLUG-493). To fix this issue you either need to upgrade JIRA to use Felix 1.2.1-atlassian-9 or create a new release of Plugins 2.3.x and included that in JIRA.
fields.summary: Jira 4.0 doesn't work with Confluence 3.1 in the same VM

fields.description:
The roadmap gadget is left blank if the time frame includes a version that has no description and JIRA is connected to Oracle.

Basically, here is what happens:

# The user creates a Version with no description.
# JIRA tries to save the description as "", but Oracle saves this as NULL.
# JIRA returns a version from the roadmap REST endpoint with no {{description}} field.
# The roadmap portlet barfs when trying to execute:

{code:javascript}
AJS.$("<td/>").addClass("versionDesc").attr("colSpan", 2).text(ver.description).appendTo(tr);
{code}

This does not seem to be a problem on databases that are able to save the "" rather than NULL. 

You can use the attached XML to reproduce the problem in any database as I have manually made the description of the only version NULL.

Regards,
Brenden.
fields.summary: Roadmap gadget is blank when it tries to render a version that has no description (on Oracle)

fields.description: Currently the {{DefaultSharedEntityManager}} has a multithreaded indexing strategy if the size is large enough, but the producer thread is awaiting the results as soon as it produces them, blocking further index operation production. It should combine them into a composite result and await on that after it has finished.
fields.summary: Improve the multithreaded performance of the SharedEntity reindexing

fields.description:
Derived from root issue : https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AG-1201

Adding a gadget spec from one of our servers that is behind SSL does not work. If you add the same gadget without using SSL, it does work.

A likely cause is that our SSL certificates are signed by CAs that are missing from the default Java cacerts file.

If this is a problem for us, it's likely to be a problem for some customers as well.
fields.summary: iGoogle does not accept Atlassian SSL certificates

fields.description:
From the root issue [AG-1200|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AG-1200]

This is a third party issue we must try to work around.
fields.summary: The iGoogle directory cannot add gadgets with inline message bundles

fields.description: Then PortalPages are indexed by the {{DefaultPortalPageManager}}, it doesn't wait for the asynchronous indexing operation to complete. Occasionally this can mean that when the current user searches across this index are stale and don't reflect the latest state of the index updates that this user made.
fields.summary: Occasional Functional Test failures caused by DefaultPortalPageManager timing issue

The method "createIssueWithSecurityLevel" is here:

fields.summary: Cannot create issue through XML RPC remote API if issue-level security is on

fields.description:
Dashboard gadgets use ajax/rest requests. Internet Explorer incorrectly caches these and so sometimes data shown on dashboard is outdated. This bug is stricly related to IE, it works correctly in Firefox and Chrome.

e.g.: You just closed a task a go back to dashboard. In the filter however the issue is still showing.

Possible fixes:
Append all ajax/rest urls with a unique parameter e.g. &uniqueTime=<miliseconds sice epoch> . 
Or make all ajax/rest requests pragma: no-cache (if IE works with this correctly)
fields.summary: Dashboard gadgets ajax requests are cached by IE and thus sometimes shows outdated data

fields.description:
I have 76 hours of work to do on a given project. The Workload Pie Report (best report title ever?) shows the correct number of hours in its table display, but the labels on the pie chart itself converts hours to days-and-hours. Unfortunately, it's using a 24-hour day instead of the defined value for day length, which in our case is 7. 

So it should say "10d 6h", but currently says "3d 4h".

Thanks.
fields.summary: Workload Pie Report shows 24 hour days
